intro: Onopordum olgae, commonly known as the Crimean thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Crimean Peninsula. It is a perennial herb characterized by its spiny leaves and purple to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Onopordum olgae is often found in open habitats such as meadows and grasslands.
